frame.name: Nuclear_process
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Initial_element</fen> is converted into a <fen>Final_element</fen> via a process of decay, fusion, or fission which changes the number or type of hadrons (protons or neutrons) in the nucleus of the atoms that make up the <fen>Element</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Element">5.5 percent of nucleii</fex> <t>decay</t> <fex name="Initial_element">from tritium</fex> <fex name="Final_element">to He3</fex> <fex name="Period_of_iterations">in a year</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Element
FE.definition: <def-root>A substance definable in terms of the kind(s) of atoms that make it up. </def-root>

FE.name: Final_element
FE.definition: <def-root>The type of <fen>Element</fen> that results from the process.</def-root>

FE.name: Initial_element
FE.definition: <def-root>The type of <fen>Element</fen> that begins the process.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Element</fen> undergoes the transformation. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the Change event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>) and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Element</fen>'s substance is converted to the <fen>Final_element</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The physical or abstract <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the change takes place. </def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>An event or state that causes the change to take place. </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the nuclear process occurs. </def-root>
